question: A and B together can complete a piece of work in 72 days, B and C together can complete it in 120 days, and A and C together in 90 days. In what time can A alone complete the work?
explanation:
(A+B)\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{72}&s=1$
(B+C)\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{120}&s=1$
(C+A)\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{90}&s=1$
Adding all three, 2(A+B+C)\'s 1 days work = $latex \\frac{1}{72}+\\frac{1}{120}+\\frac{1}{90}&s=1$
$latex => \\frac{5+3+4}{360}=\\frac{12}{360}=\\frac{1}{30}&s=1$
∴ (A+B+C)\'s 1 day\'s work = $latex \\frac{1}{60}&s=1$
Now, A\'s 1 day\'s work = (A+B+C)\'s 1 day\'s work - (B+C)\'s 1 day\'s work 
$latex =>\\frac{1}{60}-\\frac{1}{120}=\\frac{2-1}{120}=\\frac{1}{120}&s=1$
∴ A alone can comlete the work in 120 days.
Hence option [D] is correct
